intro: Chaetanthera comata, commonly known as the hairy chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive silvery underside. Its small white flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
